quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Whoever does wrong, wrongs himself; whoever does injustice, does it to himself, making himself evil.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The memory of everything is very soon overwhelmed in time.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Observe always that everything is the result of change, and get used to thinking that there is nothing Nature loves so well as to change existing forms and make new ones like them.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Accept whatever comes to you woven in the pattern of your destiny, for what could more aptly fit your needs?
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If any man despises me, that is his problem. My only concern is not doing or saying anything deserving of contempt.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Do not act as if you had ten thousand years to throw away. Death stands at your elbow. Be good for something while you live and it is in your power.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If someone can prove me wrong and show me my mistake in any thought or action, I shall gladly change. I seek the truth, which never harmed anyone: the harm is to persist in one's own self-deception and ignorance.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If you are pained by external things, it is not they that disturb you, but your own judgement of them. And it is in your power to wipe out that judgement now.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Nowhere can man find a quieter or more untroubled retreat than in his own soul.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Because a thing seems difficult for you, do not think it impossible for anyone to accomplish.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Your days are numbered. Use them to throw open the windows of your soul to the sun. If you do not, the sun will soon set, and you with it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A noble man compares and estimates himself by an idea which is higher than himself; and a mean man, by one lower than himself. The one produces aspiration; the other ambition, which is the way in which a vulgar man aspires.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A person's worth is measured by the worth of what he values.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Confine yourself to the present.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Pass then through this little space of time conformably to nature, and end thy journey in content, just as an olive falls off when it is ripe, blessing nature who produced it, and thanking the tree on which it grew.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The happiness of those who want to be popular depends on others; the happiness of those who seek pleasure fluctuates with moods outside their control; but the happiness of the wise grows out of their own free acts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: That which is really beautiful has no need of anything; not more than law, not more than truth, not more than benevolence or modesty.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Dig within. Within is the wellspring of Good; and it is always ready to bubble up, if you just dig.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Take full account of what Excellencies you possess, and in gratitude remember how you would hanker after them, if you had them not.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: What we cannot bear removes us from life; what remains can be borne.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A man must stand erect, not be kept erect by others.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing, in so far as it stands ready against the accidental and the unforeseen, and is not apt to fall.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: I was once a fortunate man but at some point fortune abandoned me.  But true good fortune is what you make for yourself. Good fortune: good character, good intentions, and good actions.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Life is opinion.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: When you arise in the moring, think of what a precious privelege it is to be alive-- to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Be like the cliff against which the waves continually break; but it stands firm and tames the fury of the water around it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: All men are made one for another: either then teach them better or bear with them.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The things you think about determine the quality of your mind.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Every living organism is fulfilled when it follows the right path for its own nature.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: It never ceases to amaze me: we all love ourselves more than other people, but care more about their opinion than our own.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Unhappy am I because this has happened to me. Not so, but happy am I, though this has happened to me, because I continue free from pain, neither crushed by the present nor fearing the future.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: How ridiculous and unrealistic is the man who is astonished at anything that happens in life.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: In the morning when thou risest unwillingly, let this thought be present - I am rising to the work of a human being. Why then am I dissatisfied if I am going to do the things for which I exist and for which I was brought into the world?
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: No man is happy who does not think himself so.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Live out your life in truth and justice, tolerant of those who are neither true nor just.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: All things fade and quickly turn to myth.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: No one can lose either the past or the future - how could anyone be deprived of what he does not possess? ... It is only the present moment of which either stands to be deprived: and if this is all he has, he cannot lose what he does not have.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Death is a release from the impressions of the senses, and from desires that make us their puppets, and from the vagaries of the mind, and from the hard service of the flesh.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Everything - a horse, a vine - is created for some duty... For what task, then, were you yourself created?
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: All things of the body stream away like a river, all things of the mind are dreams and delusion; life is warfare, and a visit to a strange land; the only lasting fame is oblivion.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A wrongdoer is often a man who has left something undone, not always one who has done something.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: It loved to happen.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Choose not to be harmed—and you won’t feel harmed. Don’t feel harmed—and you haven’t been.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Neither worse then or better is a thing made by being praised.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Look beneath the surface; let not the several quality of a thing nor its worth escape thee.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: From the philosopher Catulus, never to be dismissive of a friend's accusation, even if it seems unreasonable, but to make every effort to restore the relationship to its normal condition.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The blazing fire makes flames and brightness out of everything thrown into it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Adapt yourself to the life you have been given; and truly love the people with whom destiny has surrounded you.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: That which is not good for the swarm, neither is it good for the bee.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Observe the movements of the stars as if you were running their courses with them, and let your mind constantly dwell on the changes of the elements into each other. Such imaginings wash away the filth of life on the ground.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Time is like a river made up of the events which happen, and a violent stream; for as soon as a thing has been seen, it is carried away, and another comes in its place, and this will be carried away too.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Death smiles at us all; all we can do is smile back.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The time is at hand when you will have forgotten everything; and the time is at hand when all will have forgotten you. Always reflect that soon you will be no one, and nowhere.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Men exist for the sake of one another.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: No one loses any other life than the one he now lives, nor does one live any other life than that which he will lose.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Everything that happens, happens as it should, and if you observe carefully, you will find this to be so.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The happiness and unhappiness of the rational, social animal depends not on what he feels but on what he does; just as his virtue and vice consist not in feeling but in doing.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts; therefore guard accordingly.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Because your own strength is unequal to the task, do not assume that it is beyond the powers of man; but if anything is within the powers and province of man, believe that it is within your own compass also.  Marcus Aurelius.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: As far as you can, get into the habit of asking yourself in relation to any action taken by another: "What is his point of reference here?" But begin with yourself: examine yourself first.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: It is within our power not to make a judgement about something, and so not disturb our minds; for nothing in itself possesses the power to form our judgements.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: When men are inhuman, take care not to feel towards them as they do towards other humans.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: To refrain from imitation is the best revenge.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The honest and good man ought to be exactly like a man who smells strong, so that the bystander as soon as he comes near him must smell whether he choose or not.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Do not think that what is hard for you to master is humanly impossible; and if it is humanly possible, consider it to be within your reach.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: We are the other of the other.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: And in the case of superior things like stars, we discover a kind of unity in separation. The higher we rise on the scale of being, the easier it is to discern a connection even among things separated by vast distances.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: For outward show is a wonderful perverter of the reason.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Look to nothing, not even for a moment except to reason.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Everything is banal in experience, fleeting in duration, sordid in content; in all respects the same today as generations now dead and buried have found it to be.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Think of the universal substance, of which thou has a very small portion; and of universal time, of which a short and indivisible interval has been assigned to thee; and of that which is fixed by destiny, and how small a part of it thou art.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: It is a ridiculous thing for a man not to fly from his own badness, which is indeed possible, but to fly from other men's badness, which is impossible.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive-to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: It’s the truth I’m after, and the truth never harmed anyone. What harms us is to persist in self-deceit and ignorance.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Will any man despise me? Let him see to it. But I will see to it that I may not be found doing or saying anything that deserves to be despised.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The world is mere change, and this life, opinion.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Do not be ashamed of help.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Everything that exists is in a manner the seed of that which will be.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Not to waste time on nonsense. Not to be taken in by conjurors and hoodoo artists with their talk about incantations and exorcism and all the rest of it. Not to be obsessed with quail-fighting or other crazes like that.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: In an expression of true gratitude, sadness is conspicuous only by its absence.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Be tolerant with others and strict with yourself.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: How soon will time cover all things.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Look within. Within is the fountain of good, and it will ever bubble up, if thou wilt ever dig.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The best revenge is not to do as they do.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Today I escaped all circumstance, or rather I cast out all circumstance, for it was not outside me, but within my judgements.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Failure to read what is happening in another's soul is not easily seen as a cause of unhappiness: but those who fail to attend the motions of their own soul are necessarily unhappy.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Whatever is in any way beautiful hath its source of beauty in itself, and is complete in itself; praise forms no part of it. So it is none the worse nor the better for being praised.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Anything in any way beautiful derives its beauty from itself and asks nothing beyond itself. Praise is no part of it, for nothing is made worse or better by praise.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: We must make haste then, not only because we are daily nearer to death, but also because the conception of things and the understanding of them cease first.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The sexual embrace can only be compared with music and with prayer.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: In everything that you do, pause and ask yourself if death is a dreadful thing because it deprives you of this.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: When force of circumstance upsets your equanimity, lose no time in recovering your self-control, and do not remain out of tune longer than you can help. Habitual recurrence to the harmony will increase your mastery of it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Accustom yourself not to be disregarding of what someone else has to say: as far as possible enter into the mind of the speaker.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A Man's life is dyed the color of his imagination.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Life is a warfare and a stranger's sojourn, and after-fame is oblivion.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: That which has died falls not out of the universe. If it stays here, it also changes here, and is dissolved into its proper parts, which are elements of the universe and of thyself. And these too change, and they murmur not.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Live every day as if they last.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Do the things external which fall upon thee distract thee? Give thyself time to learn something new and good, and cease to be whirled around.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Be your own master, and look at things as a man, as a human being, as a citizen, as a mortal creature.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If something is difficult for you to accomplish, do not then think it impossible for any human being; rather, if it is humanly possible and corresponds to human nature, know that it is attainable by you as well.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: From my great-grandfather: not to have attended schools for the public; to have had good teachers at home, and to realize that this is the sort of thing on which one should spend lavishly.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: ‎Begin the morning by saying to thyself, I shall meet with the busy-body, the ungrateful, arrogant, deceitful, envious, unsocial.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If any man is able to convince me and show me that I do not think or act right, I will gladly change; for I seek the truth by which no man was ever injured. But he is injured who abides in his error and ignorance.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: He is so rich, he has no room to shit.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Give up your thirst for books, so that you do not die a grouch.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Art thou angry with him whose armpits stink? Art thou angry with him whose mouth smells foul?
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Your life is what your thoughts make it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: I can control my thoughts as necessary; then how can I be troubled? What is outside my mind means nothing to it. Absorb that lesson and your feet stand firm.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: This thing, what is it in itself, in its own constitution? What is its substance and material?
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The man of ambition thinks to find his good in the operations of others; the man of pleasure in his own sensations; but the man of understanding in his own actions.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Whatever time you choose is the right time. Not late, not early.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Strength and honor.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Retire into thyself. The rational principle which rules has this nature, that it is content with itself when it does what is just, and so secures tranquility.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Never let the future disturb you - you will meet it with the same weapons of reason and mind that, today, guard you against the present...
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Do not let the future disturb you, for you will arrive there, if you arrive, with the same reason you now apply to the present.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Wilt thou, then, my soul, never be good and simple and one and naked, more manifest than the body which surrounds thee?
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: It is in your own power to maintain the beauty of your soul, or to be a decent human being.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Be cheerful also, and seek not external help nor the tranquility which others give. A man then must stand erect, not be kept erect by others.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: All of us are creatures of a day; the rememberer and the remembered alike.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Objective judgment, now, at this very moment. Unselfish action, now, at this very moment. Willing acceptance—now, at this very moment—of all external events. That’s all you need.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: To live happily is an inward power of the soul.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Everything that happens is either endurable or not. If it’s endurable, then endure it. Stop complaining. If it’s unendurable … then stop complaining. Your destruction will mean its end as well.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Meditate upon what you ought to be in body and soul when death overtakes you; meditate on the brevity of life, and the measureless gulf of eternity behind it and before, and upon the frailty of everything material.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Its a dream, a fearful dream, life is.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Every man is worth just so much as the things about which he busies himself.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: No more roundabout discussions of what makes a good man. Be one!
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: All things from eternity are of like forms and come round in a circle.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: That all is as thinking makes it so – and you control your thinking. So remove your judgements whenever you wish and then there is calm - as the sailor rounding the cape finds smooth water and the welcome of a waveless bay.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: How many together with whom I came into the world are already gone out of it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: From my Great-grandfather, not to have frequented public schools, and to have had good teachers at home, and to know that on such things a man should spend liberally.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If unwilling to rise in the morning, say to thyself, ‘I awake to do the work of a man.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: That to expect bad people not to injure others is crazy. It's to ask the impossible. And to let them behave like that to other people but expect them to exempt you is arrogant--the act of a tyrant.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Nothing is more scandalous than a man that is proud of his humility.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The whole universe is change and life itself is but what you deem it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Anger and the sorrow it produces are far more harmful than the things which make us angry.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Swiftly the remembrance of all things is buried in the gulf of eternity.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: How good it is, when you have roast meat or suchlike foods before you, to impress on your mind that this is the dead body of a fish, this the dead body of a bird or pig.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Never value the advantages derived from anything involving breach of faith, loss of self-respect, hatred, suspicion, or execration of others, insincerity, or the desire for something which has to be veiled and curtained.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Does the emerald lose its beauty for lack of admiration?
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: So other people hurt me? That’s their problem. Their character and actions are not mine. What is done to me is ordained by nature, what I do by my own.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Ambition means tying your well-being to what other people say or do. Self-indulgence means tying it to the things that happen to you. Sanity means tying it to your own actions.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Today I escaped from anxiety. Or no, I discarded it, because it was within me, in my own perceptions—not outside.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: To read with diligence; not to rest satisfied with a light and superficial knowledge, nor quickly to assent to things commonly spoken.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Your mind will be like its habitual thoughts; for the soul becomes dyed with the colour of its thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The universe is change, and life mere opinion.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: All is ephemeral, both what remembers and what is remembered.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: What else did you expect from helping someone out? Isn’t it enough that you’ve done what your nature demands? You want a salary for it too? As if your eyes expected a reward for seeing, or your feet for walking. That’s what they were made for.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: All things fade into the storied past, and in a little while are shrouded in oblivion.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Everything of the body is a river. Everything of the soul is dream and vapour. Life is war and the abode of a stranger. The only fame after death is oblivion.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Do every act of your life as if it were your last.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Give your heart to the trade you have learnt, and draw refreshment from it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Nothing has such power to broaden the mind as the ability to investigate systematically and truly all that comes under thy observation in life.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Since it is possible that you might depart from life this very moment, regulate every act and thought accordingly.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Never value anything as profitable that compels you to break your promise, to lose your self-respect, to hate any man, to suspect, to curse, to act the hypocrite, to desire anything that needs walls and curtains.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: It’s silly to try to escape other people’s faults. They are inescapable. Just try to escape your own.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Everything is only for a day, both that which remembers and that which is remembered.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: We ought to do good to others as simply as a horse runs, or a bee makes honey, or a vine bears grapes season after season without thinking of the grapes it has borne.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: How much time he gains who does not look to see what his neighbor says or does or thinks, but only at what he does himself, to make it just and holy.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The offender needs pity, not wrath; those who must needs be corrected, should be treated with tact and gentleness; and one must be always ready to learn better. 'The best kind of revenge is, not to become like unto them.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The things ordained for you—teach yourself to be at one with those. And the people who share them with you—treat them with love. With real love.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Forget everything else. Keep hold of this alone and remember it: Each of us lives only now, this brief instant. The rest has been lived already, or is impossible to see.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: There is no man so blessed that some who stand by his deathbed won't hail the occasion with delight.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: To be like the rock that the waves keep crashing over. It stands unmoved and the raging of the sea falls still around it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Take the shortest route, the one that nature planned—to speak and act in the healthiest way. Do that, and be free of pain and stress, free of all calculation and pretension.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: In everything that you do, pause and ask yourself if death is a dreadful thing because it deprives you of this.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Not to assume it’s impossible because you find it hard. But to recognize that if it’s humanly possible, you can do it too.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If anyone can refute me—show me I’m making a mistake or looking at things from the wrong perspective—I’ll gladly change. It’s the truth I’m after, and the truth never harmed anyone. What harms us is to persist in self-deceit and ignorance.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The pride which is proud of want of pride is the most intolerable of all.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Death is a cessation from the impression of the senses, the tyranny of the passions, the errors of the mind, and the servitude of the body.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A good man does not spy around for the black spots in others, but presses unswervingly on towards his mark.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength. When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive - to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: In no great while you will be no one and nowhere, and nothing that you now behold will be in existence, nor will anyone now alive. For it is in the nature of all things to change and alter and perish, so that others may arise in their turn.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius
